meanings.definition: A straight line that intersects a curve at two or more points.
meanings.sent1: The artist drew secants on the graph to show where the line crossed the curve.
meanings.sent2: The secants of the circle intersected at two distinct points.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the secants on the tree trunk were secret codes.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as secants, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the secants of the footprints to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: A trigonometric function that is the reciprocal of the cosine function.
meanings.sent1: In trigonometry, students learn about the secants and cosines.
meanings.sent2: The secants of an angle can be calculated using specific formulas.
meanings.sent3: The math teacher joked that the secants and cosines were having a party in the unit circle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the secants of a sine wave, rising and falling.
meanings.sent5: The music of the orchestra resonated with the harmonious dance of secants and cosines.
